misuse: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
description: The AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding algorithm is vulnerable to attacks such as padding oracle attacks, which can allow an attacker to retrieve the plaintext of encrypted data. It is recommended to use a more secure algorithm such as AES/GCM/NoPadding or AES/EAX/NoPadding.
recommendation: Replace AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding with AES/GCM/NoPadding or AES/EAX/NoPadding in the cipher.getInstance() method.

description: The default key is hardcoded in the Co class, which makes it easy to extract and use for unauthorized access to the encrypted data. It is recommended to use a secure key management system to store and manage the encryption key.
recommendation: Replace the hardcoded default key with a key generated by a secure key management system.

description: The key length of 16 bytes is too short to provide adequate encryption strength. It is recommended to use a key length of at least 32 bytes for AES encryption.
recommendation: Increase the key length to at least 32 bytes.
